title: ● Did cities close schools, businesses, during the 1918 epidemic?
subtitle: The year 2020 was not the first time that public places had been ordered to be closed to prevent the spread of the disease.
author: Dan Evon
vclaim: A 1918 newspaper clipping of "public announcement" documents from the city of Kiluna, British Columbia, announces that schools, cinema theatres and other public places will be closed to prevent the spread of the Spanish flu.
